Reviews.Title: “It's old, cheap, but clean”
Reviews.Author: Pat B
Reviews.Content: During a recent convention -when every room in Toronto was sold or was $350 a night - I was sent to the Alexandra by an acquaintance who always stays there. It seemed to be unusual - up a quiet suburban street in an old area of Toronto - nearby Queen Street had many eclectic business, including great restaurants and a couple of bong shops (yes, I was astonished). But the location was alarming and the exterior appearance was off-putting (old brick and it didn't look like a hotel). The Alexandra used to be a self-help retirement facility - small rooms with cooking facilities. It looks old and run down, but it's actually comfortable and very clean, and I'd stay again. No restaurant there so a walk to Queen Street to many eating places is the daily program, or buy food and take it back - the rooms all have a microwave, cook top, small refrigerator. The central heat is a ceiling thermal system that was overwhelmed on a really cold night - so it's not the Ritz - but it is a ten dollar cab ride to the downtown business district. There is no pool or amenities of any kind. But it is in the $80 range (except during peak periods when they want $100 plus tax). Toronto is an expensive city and this is about the cheapest accommodation in town - but I would stay again - it's a bed, it's clean, and it worked for me. They also have wi-fi and that was a help. And local phone calls are only 35c apiece - however the wi-fi was chronically slow at times and they have the nerve to charge for parking - $5 a day. Their website says it is downtown - which it is not - but it is a $10 cab ride so it's not too far out. It worked for me. I've rated the rooms as poor - because they aren't average - but they are clean and livable. The website ( http://www.alexandrahotel.com ) has photos which make it look better than it is - but it's ok - just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, a few streetcar stops from downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: thor_74HH
Reviews.Content: I have been to Toronto twice before and stayed virtually within spitting distance of Dundas Square. For my stay in February 2012, I chose this hotel, because rooms were advertised to have a small pantry. The hotel is located a few stops by streetcar from Dundas Square/Eaton Centre. There are basically three streetcar lines (on Dundas, on Queen and on Bathhurst) and you can walk to Spadina Ave. I did not feel unsafe, even when I returned a bit later at night. Also, the hotel is still located within walking distance of all major downtown attractions if you take the time to stroll down the streets. (Something I like to do anyway as you see the city you're visiting differently anyway, if you walk around a lot.) The room is resonably sized, although I have to say, that the pictures I saw on the hotel website give a larger impression that my room was in reality. The pantry was actually directly beside the bed - you could reach into the fridge lying in the bed. (Which I guess for some can be an advantage...) My room was clean, but it could use some renovation and that made room and bathroom appear a bit unclean. Furniture and cupboards have seen their best days a few years back. Front desk staff is very helpful and friendly. Upon check-in you'll get a key to the front door downstairs as well as your room key. Parking is charged extra. I arrived early and it was no problem checking in at that time. Still, the hotel offers a good value for money. Just in my case I could have booked a special offer in the downtown centre at an almost similar rate. Otherwise, it's a good place for anyone staying in Toronto. I would not do any more cooking than maybe making toast and tea for breaktfast. But doing this and maybe ordering take-out, will reduce your overall budget.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off, spend ur money elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Kenoragrrl
Reviews.Content: I phoned for a room, notifying them on the phone that there were 3 of us, my daughter being 17. The fee was 79.99 which was reasonable. Checking in there were 3 of us. Checking out there were again 3 of us and now this new lady charged us about an extra $12 Bc there were 3 of us? Told her we called said3, showed up with 3 last night etc...so stupid just to shut her up we paid it. The room was overpowered with a stench, was like wow wtf is that? Cheap perfume. Total room charge with parking totaled about 115. Go somewhere else for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: Kootenay23
Reviews.Content: Well priced for the city (under $100 a night). Was not fancy at, all but had good basic ammenities (kitchen, wifi) and seemed reasaonably clean. The area seemed a little scuzzy (homeless people in neighbouring park, etc), but I didn't feel afraid walking through it as a single women. My car and canoe were untouched in the parking lot for three days. It took my about a half hour or so to walk to the CN tower from here so I would consider it fairly close to everything. The neighbourhood seems to get better as well after a few minutes of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexander_StPete
Reviews.Content: Nice, friendly and comfortable. Located near the China town - about 30 min by walk from city center and Railway station. A lot of places to eat in the neighborhood. The room was not very big but with the kitchen and bathroom. Laundry on the floor. Very friendly and helpful staff. Enjoyed the stay. Can recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Better than it looks”
Reviews.Author: Blondethoughts
Reviews.Content: Do not be put off by the exterior of this hotel - it is better inside. Not in anyway luxurious but clean & tidy. Our room was quiet spacious, the bathroom was clean & the staff friendly - cant really ask for more for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Tony U
Reviews.Content: I arrived here after leaving my previous accommodation in disgust. The Alexandra made my feel much better about my stay in Toronto. Location was acceptable (I like to walk) but transport was nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Probably wouldn't stay again though”
Reviews.Author: ScoobCW
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I originally booked the Grange hotel, but upon arriving we were told that the parking lot was full and that we would have to stay at the Alexandra, about a block and a half away. This seemed fine, as the Grange was across the street from a kind of sketchy area, and the Alexandra is up the street from a theatre and right next to a park. The person in the Lobby was very friendly and we recieved the keys to our room right away. Upon getting to our room - it was pretty standard. There were 2 beds a small kitchenette and a bathroom - very no frills but it suited our needs. The only complaint I would have is that the next morning, my boyfriend found a bug in the bed, that looked like a small beetle. He put it in a cup and went to speak to the manager. Instead he was told to come back at check out and that a manager would deal with it then. When we were checking out my boyfriend spoke to the manager, who told him that the bug was a spider (which is was clearly not) and that that was that. Otherwise the hotel was fine, but because of this experience, I probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good value in a convenient place.”
Reviews.Author: nimrod987
Reviews.Content: Some prior reviews mentioned that this hotel is in a run-down neighborhood. It's not like that. There is a housing project in a different part of the Alexandra Park block, and the area is ethnic. But the hotel itself is located in a quiet residential part of the block. People walk through the area and it's just fine. It's also convenient with a streetcar stop about 2 minutes away. There are some non-standard things that were a little bit weird. The hotel used to be some kind of apartment complex, so when I arrived I had to sign a form that said I was not a tenant, just a lodger. They also asked for a credit card imprint as a "deposit." It was either that or $100 in cash, but when I left they gave the credit card slip back so they didn't keep anything. The room did have a kitchen, complete with some pots and utensils. There was also a refrigerator and microwave. The building and halls were sort of old, and the room itself, including the TV, was old style, but it was clean and quiet. It was comfortable to settle in.

Reviews.Title: “It fit the bill”
Reviews.Author: clinton1941
Reviews.Content: It fit the bill for what I was looking for. It was about a 20 minute walk from where I had to be. There is a park across the street. The room (kitchenette) was clean and it offered me the ability to cook if I wanted to. Close to public transportation. About an hour to the airport (Pearson) at a cost of $2.00 !! The neigborhood is a mix of different types residential homes (apts, duplexs, etc). If I was going back to Toronto I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Alexandra fits the bill for economic lodging in town”
Reviews.Author: homesort
Reviews.Content: The Alexandra was just what we seeking for an economical stay in the central city area of Toronto. Three of us had a room with one double and one single bed. The hotel is in a quiet residential neighborhood just outside of Chinatown off Dundas St., and close by to Kensington Market. The kitchenette saved us money on breakfasts, buying supplies at a grocery store on nearby Queen St. The room was on the smallish side but very clean. It had A/C ,but the windows also opened for fresh air. Since we didn't bring a laptop for the free WiFi, the public library nearby across the public park had free internet access. The streetcars stops were on all 3 nearby main streets in either direction.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: bluejeans2
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at this hotel. Room was basic but a good size and kept clean. Kitchenette was very useful. Location was excellent. People who worked here were very helpful. It was great to have parking. It was quiet at night. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: bahrom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently when my relatives were visiting Toronto. They had their little kid with them and couldn't find a suite for a reasonable price so I just booked the hotel for me and let them stay in my condo. As I only needed a place to sleep I looked for the cheapest place around and this was it. Given the price I wasn't expecting much but this was a bit below even my low expectations. The building is very old and run down. The window AC in my room made a lot of noise when turned on but did not cool the air at all. The remote control for the TV did not work. The sink in the bathroom was stopped up. Lastly, the shower head was positioned so low on the wall that I had to duck to get my head under it. ( And I'm 5'9'' - not the tallest guy around). On the plus side the room had a kitchenette so I guess it can be used as short term furnished housing.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: PDE123
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel two times now and have to say that it's certainly a good value. I paid under $100 CAD per night on a weekend when other hotels in the area were charging over $250 a night. Staying at the Alexandra was definitely easy on the wallet. Having said that, you get what you pay for. The hotel shows its' age and in some places (i.e. hallways, lobby area) shows some "grimy" spots. The rooms themselves are on the smaller side, but if you're just looking for a place to put your suitcase and sleep, the size is fine. As for cleanliness, it's certainly not the worst hotel I've ever stayed in, but it's not the best either. The sheets and towels were clean, but there were a few stray hairs in the bathroom. The carpets are old and I would recommend keeping your shoes on. The room we stayed in had a double bed and a single bed, along with a desk, a TV, mini-fridge, range, microwave, sink and cupboards. I could see how it would be handy for an extended stay. The staff at the front desk was fine, nothing too rude, but nothing too welcoming either. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't mind saving a few bucks and staying in a "lower end" hotel. My wife and I don't mind saving a few dollars if it means that the hotel room is less than spectacular. During the daytime, the neighborhood was great - at night time, not so much. There's a park behind the hotel and each morning, quite a few elderly folks were doing their morning workout. At night, there were a few "vagrants" around the neighborhood, but I didn't see anything too bad. If you get lost, I'd recommend taking a cab home after a night out, but if you know where you're going, it's only a couple blocks off of Queen Street.

Reviews.Title: “An old standby!”
Reviews.Author: lesiku
Reviews.Content: Before my best friend moved to Toronto, she and I stayed at the Alexandra a couple of times for our nights of clubbing or concerts. Because it's meant for long-term stay, each room I've ever had has had a stove, sink, bar fridge, cable TV, and a full bathroom. Yeah, it's not in the best area (in fact, walking around there at night is sorta scary), but it's a block away from a major streetcar route. I've always been pleased with the value.

Reviews.Title: “pretty decent place”
Reviews.Author: misstmoss
Reviews.Content: my only complaint about the hotel was the staff. I called a couple times before our stay and felt like the staff was very rude and abrupt on the phone. In person it seemed like they all had zero personality. Other then that the room was clean and the location was close to everything we needed to get to. The beds were great we slept very well, and the internet worked really well. All in all I would stay again. The price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Basic accomaditions you neednomore”
Reviews.Author: folsomdale
Reviews.Content: Have been satying at this Hotel for the last15 years and find it very pleasant and very quiet place with a friendley staff. Only minutes away to down town by street car. Will be staying here again. Dont believe all the negative reviews you read about this place. I dont know what they expect.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but great value”
Reviews.Author: LouLouLouey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for one night. This place is not the Hilton - it is on the basic side - it kind of reminded me of a student dorm room, except it was our own room with kitchenette and private bathroom. But it was very clean, quiet and the location is pretty good - about 20 minute walk to the CN Tower. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: JasmineMarti
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online, and by all appearances it seemed decent online, but when we arrived it turned out to be a very shabby property. Everything seemed to fall apart in our room, everything seemed to be flimsy and shook. The location is off of trendy Queen Street West, and is rather central, but it is at least 20-25 minutes walking to Eaton Centre, whereas when I had called the hotel and asked about the distance in terms of walking to Eaton Centre, they had told me it was five minutes. Granted, there is a streetcar that runs on Queen Street West. Anyway, I would never book at this again. In fact, we searched for another property in town, and moved three days later.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great.”
Reviews.Author: caseyjones003
Reviews.Content: I read reviews for this hotel and decided that this is the only place I would be able to stay for my budget. When I first pulled up, I did not think the neighborhood was that bad. And when I first walked in, I did not think it was that bad either. The man at the desk was very friendly and I explained to him that I booked for two people, but three people were staying. The parking fee was $4.00 which was fine. I left to go to a concert and when I got back, there were no parking spaces so I had to park on the street (luckily I did not get ticketed) however, this made that 4.00 pointless and could have bought one of toronto's expensive beers with that. The stay was fine but upon checkout, I told the woman that my bank account was not letting me take money out and asked if they have double charged me for the room. She said no and asked if three people stayed in the room and I explained to her the situation the night before and she charged me $6.00 for the third person and I argued it and she said that she was "only doing her job and that life is too short to be bitter"!!!!!! How RUDE! I am finally home and checked my bank account, and they did double charge me, so I called them, and they said they will call me back. It has been 5 hours and no phone call and my bank account in the negatives. NOT HAPPY!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, Clean, Basic Accomodation Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: jangale
Reviews.Content: My husband had testsat 9am 2 days in a row at Toronto Western Hospital, and this property is a 5 min walk. I read the reviews and figured it wouldn't be too expensive to stay over. I asked about early check in and they said because it was during the week, that shouldn't be a problem. We actually arrived earlier than I thought, and they were very gracious and quickly checked us in "so he could lie down. Oh, and here are menus if you need to order in dinner". Five minutes after we got to the room, the maid came in apologizing, she was going to put the heat up before we arrived. The area yes is not one I would feel comfortable walking alone at night. I think it was a student residence at one time. However, I was impressed with the cleanliness and how they try to make it a good experience. The walls are paper thin, but you do have a kitchenette and they have appeared to try to anticipate your needs. The Hilton it is not, but if you want an inexpensive place in Toronto if you have plans outside the hotel, it is perfect. We ate dinner at the hospital, which has several restaurants in the Atrium since my husband wasn't up to going out. If we hadn't taken the bus to Toronto I would have brought more food and utilized the microwave or the burners. They did their best for my husband, and I am extremely grateful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, better price, no frills”
Reviews.Author: BorderCityBoy
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Alexandra in October 2008. The hotel was one of the cheapest ones I could find in Downtown Toronto. We were traveling on a budget, and didn't want to spend a lot on accommodations. The rooms were a good size, but a little tired. The beds were comfortable, and the sheets were clean. The bathroom was clean as well. Check in was quick and easy, and there is plenty of parking on site. The hotel is centrally located, and within walking distance to everything in Downtown Toronto. If you aren't up for walking, the street car runs, only block from the hotel, offering quick and easy connections to the subway system. If you're looking for a cheap, clean, centrally located hotel, then look no further. As for some of the reviews stating the area seems run down around the hotel, most of those "run down" homes, run in the half million dollar range. So use your own judgement there. There is a new large condo/townhouse development right around the corner as well. Don't expect a 4 star stay, but there are far worse hotels you could stay at. In fact I've stayed at chains that were worse. All in all, one of the best bargains for a cheap night in Downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: LondonJourneymaker
Reviews.Content: Positives: The location to the city was good. A short walk to Queen St Wst. It backs onto a small park which has a 50m outdoor public pool in it which was free to use. Transport links were ok. You can take the airport public express bus to Kipling Station then the streetcar from Dundas St Wst Station to nearby the hotel (Stop: Denison Ave). Walk past the pool through the park to get to the hotel. All for a bargain $2.75 adult one way fare. It's also easy to get around on the street cars along Queen St - out to the beaches etc. Studio style room, small but clean and had the benefit of a fridge, cooker, toaster and cutlery etc if you want to prepare your own meals. Had LAN cable for free internet from a laptop. Basic and fairly old facilites but adaquate. Good Sushi nearby. Negatives: The neighbourhood didn't feel completely safe for a single girl traveling on my own. I had no problems but you have to walk through a more dodgy area of town and the street to get to the hotel is quite dark and empty. Alot of people seem to ask you for money but this was perhaps a feature of Toronto itself. Some of them seemed better off than me. Quite an old building, I think people are living there long term. Shower a bit hot and cold. Overall: I think you get what you pay for, staying this close to the city for a reasonable price. I think I would have a look elsewhere though if I were to go back. Maybe on the beaches side of the city. Seemed a much nicer area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: 2Pieces
Reviews.Content: We got to Toronto late on a Friday night and did not know where the hotel was located. We spoke with a nice man at the front desk named Greg who kindly explained how to get there. Luckily they have someone at the desk 24 hours a day so that was of great convenience. The room was small but cozy and had a double and a single bed. An air conditioner kept the room cool and there was a TV and an Ethernet cable for Internet connectivity. Overall the room was clean and we had everything we needed. It was great that every room also comes equipped with a kitchenette including a fridge, microwave, toaster and a two burner stove. Note: Bring an alarm of some sort because you have to pay a deposit at the desk to get one. The location was right downtown off of a main street (Queen St). There are plenty of places to eat and drink everywhere you look in the neighborhood and public transportation is all around you. There is also a park adjacent to the hotel that has a playground, ball fields, a skate park, a pool and a street hockey rink. We had no trouble walking to everything we wanted to see from the hotel. The neighborhood is lively but I wouldn't say that it is sketchy. I felt safe at all times walking around at night. The hotel sits back off Queen about 2 or 3 blocks so it is in a residential area which was quiet and diverse. Overall this is a good place to stay while in Toronto on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Alexandra Hotel -awful area to stay in”
Reviews.Author: UkGina
Reviews.Content: After looking at the reviews on this hotel we thought it would not be a bad place to stay for the price. The hotel was OK, very dated, but the area was awful, very run down. It took us an hour to find it by foot and when we asked a police man where it was he did not know either and had to radio in to find out. He looked at us a bit strangely, as I think he couldn't believe we were going to stay in the area. We didn't stay out late that night because we did not feel safe walking around the area. . Thank god we only booked one night, you pay for what you get definitely at this place! We would never advise anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: CelesteLauren
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Alexandra Hotel in June of 2008. It was completely affordable, and in a great location! It's in a residential area, so it felt safe enough to explore by foot. It's only 2 blocks off Queen Street, close to several local markets and great stores. The room had a small kitchette, so we made good use of our fridge. The room was a decent size, the bathroom needed a little updating - but was nice and clean. One definite bonus was the A/C unit in the room. It was old, but kept us nice and cool in the horribly humid Toronto weather. The bedding seemed old and worn, and the beds gave both of us horrible back aches - but, I guess you get what you pay for. All in all, I would recommend this hotel for budget savy travelers who want to be close to good shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: BeenThere1949
Reviews.Content: For the price in the downtown area of Toronto, this hotel can't be beat. All rooms include one queen and one twin bed, and a minimally equipped mini-kitchen in the same room (very handy for breakfast). Parking is only $3.50/night extra...this is a real steal! The hotel appears to be a converted apartment building...basically all units are studio apartments. They are furnished simply (early arborite and chrome), and are clean and comfortable. The location is very central, but yet quiet. Unlike either of the "centrally located" Days Inns, no nasty smells. And we felt safe. The bed was comfortable, the AC was pre-set, but not quite cool enough for our liking...instead, we just left the window open. I'm not convinced I would be as happy if we were in the middle of a heat wave. Washers, dryers, and irons are available on each floor. If you want a clock radio or hair dryer there is a $10 deposit. We normally travel with our "tools", so this was not an issue for us. So it's all about compromise...for $95/night, we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and spartan”
Reviews.Author: g2k
Reviews.Content: Very good location especially for the price. Very clean but rooms were small, although had sink, stove, microwave & small fridge. Finishes were of very low quality. Requires a deposit for many standard features such as iron, coffee maker, alarm clock, etc. Not for everyone but if you need a place to crash and won't spend much time there pretty good. No hotel amenities so don't expect to lounge in the lobby or at the pool. Located in a residential area close to exciting Queen St. W. near Bathurst.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place for little cost”
Reviews.Author: SparksUk
Reviews.Content: This accomodation is basic but clean. Its excellent value for money. I'm a single woman staying here on my own at the moment and I feel completely safe in the area as long as I do not venture out too late at night (this is the precaution I would take if I were anywhere unfamiliar). The rooms are equipped with a small kitchen (with all appliances - including plates/cutlery), a bed, sofa, desk, dining table, TV, Internet access point (no WIFI so please bring your own cable - although they will rent you one if you dont bring it yourself!), Air Con (although this produces a weird smell when I put it on so tend to leave the window open instead), double wardrobe and a bathroom with shower/bath. Each floor has its own laundry (although I haven't needed to use this yet) and its generally very quiet at night. From the 6th floor I have amazing views of the CN tower and city. Everyday my room is cleaned, the bathrooms are cleaned and towels are changed. My bed is made and any washing up I have to do is done! The maids are very considerate and friendly. As for the area around the hotel - it's mainly residential with a park behind the hotel (wouldn't like to go there late at night) and a small school right next to the complex. Access to the centre of the city is a 30 minute walk down Queen Street West which becomes better the other side of Spadina. Infact its a very trendy area, with lots going on and lots and lots of shops. Behind the hotel, and a short walk up Spadina takes you to the famous Kensington Market. Not much further and you are well into Chinatown (one of the largest!). Walk south and you are about a 30 min from the CN tower itself and also the harbourfront. I was nervous about coming to the accomodation (after reading a few reviews) but have not had a problem yet. The area on first sight is a bit daunting but as you integrate yourself you realise it for what it is - a multicultural residential area with the small shops making this place very diverse. If you are not fussy about accomodation and want something reasonable then I would recommend this to you as a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and certainly good enough”
Reviews.Author: lysettef
Reviews.Content: Alexandra is a cheap hotel in the centre of Toronto. I wasn't sure to book first, reading all the reviews on the internet. But I'm happy we did. We stayed for two nights. It's a twenty minute walk to the CN tower and Skydome and about the same to Eaton centre. Nearby are a lot of places to eat. Try for the fun the hospital on the other side of the park for breakfast! A lot of choices and not the fastfood like you find in the neigbourhood. Some people say that the neigbourhood is bad. I personnaly found it okay. And it's very cheap to park your car in fornt of the hotel (3.5 CAD per night. In other places it's 15 CAD!!) I did not got back to this hotel for our last night in Toronto. But that was because we wanted to be more close to the Eaton centre for shopping on our last day. Otherwise, it was okay! The only bad thing I can think of is the smell of smoking in the room. But there is so much to do in the city that your not much around in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Did the Job”
Reviews.Author: jimbo_online
Reviews.Content: The hotel wasn't in the luxurious part of the city, but located about a 10/15 minute walk away from the hustle and bustle. The neighbourhood looked run down, but to say it looked crime ridden etc is unfair and toffee-nosed. Had my details on arrival and I paid there and then. I thought the hotel corridors and lift had a strange odour to them. The room was ok, pretty spacious. I had a double bed and a single in one room with a small kitchenette. The walls were pretty thin and shakey. Every time my neighbour turned a tap on it was amazingly loud. The staff were pretty helpful, they ordered me numerous cabs. The Asian guy seemed grumpy all the time though. It was one of the cheapest hotels I found downtown, quite good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “An okay place for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: KateSW
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a slightly shady neighborhood off of Queen Street. A pretty good value for the money but very tired rooms and you do need to bring your own alarm clock. There is a kitchenette that you can do microwaving and making tea/coffee in. Queen street is within walking distance and there are several convenient shops selling simple foods as well as a lot of ethnic places like Thai food. I would have felt sad if I was here for days but for a place to sleep and eat a couple of meals it was fine. Kate

Reviews.Title: “good bargain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price, you can't beat it. And the fact that its not in a very touristy area makes it more interesting. I dont know why everyone is complaining about the area, its like any downtown, its fine to walk around during the day time, probably ok at night time - as long as you don't start chanting bible quotes or so forth. The staff were the only real complaint, they seemed lazy and unwilling to assist you. But compared to the pricey joints closer to Yonge and King St, this place is a no-brainer for the tourist with low cash flow. Btw, the hotel is just south of the charming Kensington Market area which is very eclectic and pedestrian-friendly, its worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Bad neighbourhood? Give me a break!”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: OK, if you are looking for five-star luxury, steer clear of this place. If you are looking for an inexpensive option in a vibrant neighbourhood, consider the Alexandra. All I can say is that those who have complained about the neighbourhood have misread the signs. This hotel is just off Queen Street West. Our taxi driver knew exactly where Ryerson street was. It's between Bathurst and Spadina. Queen Street offers a vibrant cafÃ© culture and great boutique shops. The Alexandra is a stone's throw from Chinatown on Spadina, and within walking distance of the Roger's Centre (Skydome) and even downtown. The Queen streetcar is 100 metres from the door. There aren't many "dangerous" neighbourhoods in Toronto, and this is certainly not one of them. It may appear a bit frayed at the edges, even rundown to some. But it is as safe as any large city area can be. As for the hotel, we stayed a week and had a great experience. Even the staff were friendly to us, although we might have been lucky. Indeed, we had a major problem that was quickly and amicably resolved. In one of the rooms (we had three) there was a strong smell of what seemed to be urine in the bathroom. We assumed that it hadn't been cleaned. It turned out that it was someone cooking something very smelly in the next door room, and it was filtering through the air vent. We were quickly and courteously moved to another room. Which brings me to another issue. You may see this hotel advertised as offering "suites" or "apartments". Suites these are not, and they are definitely not apartments. They are two-bedded rooms with a kitchenette in the room. In some rooms (we saw four and all were slightly different) the kitchen is only a few inches from one of the beds. It would be very cramped for more than two adults and one child. Still you can cook (although there are cheap options for eating out, especially in Chinatown) and the fridge is useful. All things considered, if you were staying a while in Toronto, this is a good option. Normal precautions are all you need to stay safe in this or any other part of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's about 100 ft up a side road from Queen Street West which is where the action is in Tee Town - tonnes of live music (Rivoli, Jeff Healey's place etc), book shops, guitar shops, 24 hour food etc. Completely safe area, some reviewers made it sound like Lagos but it's virtually crime free yet without the soul squeezed out in the process. Taxis are plentiful and as cheap as chips if you want to head over to the CN Tower (which is actually ace) and chain stores etc, it's really a short distance, I walked it every time without a second thought. Being a short way up a side street from "Queen West" means you are within a stone's throw of the most vibrant and interesting neighbourhood in the city, but with just enough real estate between you and it when you're going to sleep. The hotel offers decent sized rooms with en suite bathrooms, cooking facilities (for lighting cigs mostly), fridge, on-site laundry, parking, what more could you want for the price? And the location really is great. My only complaint would be the staggeringly hostile staff, although they got the job done. I suppose that makes my group sound like the guests from hell but we are a low-maintenence crowd - the most polite and simple inquiry was met with at best a glowering silence or a curt "in a minute". So, location 10/10, price 10/10, facilities 10/10, attitude 1/10 (so if you can stand a traumatic stand-off with the woman on reception just by asking for directions to a cashpoint, it's a winner).

Reviews.Title: “Great value!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What more could you want? For a rate way less than most downtown Toronto hotels you get 2 beds, a kitchenette, TV, air conditioning, a decent sized bathroom, and everything you could want in a hotel room. Not too fancy, but everything you'd need. A little hard to find, especially if you're from out of town, but well worth it. Would definitely recommend it and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy but sufficient”
Reviews.Author: SuisseGal
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Alexandra while in town for a conference and could not afford to stay in the conference hotel. I had a wonderful experience. My room was clean and very comfortable. Queen St., just a few minutes' walk away, has terrific public transportation to downtown. The neighborhood made me nervous at first but after venturing out I realized that it was a wonderful ethnic area with lots of interesting shops and restaurants. I was not afraid to walk around after dark (I was cautious, but no more than I would be anywhere). It's not fancy, and the neighborhood in the immediate block is a little edgy, but my experience (3 days) was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing location and element...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel. I chose this hotel because the price seemed pretty reasonable. It is in a terrible location, it took me 3 hours just to find the hotel, and the locals that I asked for assistance never heard of this hotel or ryerson st. This should have been a sign for me :( When I finally found the hotel, I was very uncomfortable with the location. I drove my a luxury car, and I noticed that as I went into the hotel there was a group of young guys looking into my car. It is located in a kind of runned down neighborhood and its not on a main street. It was pretty late and I had already payed for one night,prior to arriving so I spent one night in that dive. The next morning, I woke up at 5 am and checked out of there. All I have to say is, Please don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as it seemed at first”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was appalled at first by the run-down neighborhood and the ... spartan ... facilities offered by this hotel. Very reminescent of a college dorm. But the neighborhood, which looked like a high crime area by night, turned out to be mostly occupied by immigrant Chinese families in the calm light of dawn, so it is probably okay. The linen was threadbare but serviceable, the high speed connection was both actually high speed and free. The staff was not professionally trained but cooperative. In retrospect it was not a bad experience for the money. But don't stay here if you value appearances. It ain't got any.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad”
Reviews.Author: eers
Reviews.Content: The total charge for 1 night was about CAD 110. The same people also run GRANGE Apartment hotel, which is only a block away.. I had booked my room in Grange Hotel and was directed to Alexandra when we arrived to checkin. All cons, no pros 1) The room had a very bad smell of some dog/pet 2) The bed and other stuff in the room were very old. 3) The guy at reception was very rude, when asked for direction to nearest scotia bank location 4) Though they claim the hotel is at the heart of the city, The area where the hotel located is shady/fishy. One will not feel very safe stepping out of hotel in the night. I am not some one who used to 3* facilities and got shocked seeing a small scale hotel. This stay was really a worst experience by any standards.

Reviews.Title: “Get the maximum of your money!”
Reviews.Author: Urbanlook
Reviews.Content: OK, this is not a palace, but for 70 canadian $, you have TV, kitchen, clean room, bathroom, WOW! The place is central, quiet, perfect for low budget who expect a bigger room. I loved my stay there, and would return anytime.

HotelInfo.Name: Alexandra Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 77 Ryerson Avenue | at Queen Street West, Toronto, Ontario M5T 2V4, Canada
